sentence.Network_en: The country simply cannot absorb this influx of refugees.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个国家实在不能接纳这么多涌入的难民.

sentence.Network_en: The country sealed its borders to prevent the influx of illegal immigrants.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了防止非法移民大量湧入,该国封闭了边境.

sentence.Network_en: There was a sudden influx of goods onto the market.
sentence.Network_cn: 大批商品一下子涌入市场.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting an inflow of liquid, gas, or light): from late Latin influxus, from influere 'flow in' (see influence)

entry.def: An influx of people or things into a place is their arrival there in large numbers.

example.ex: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
example.tran: 大批难民涌入产生的问题

example.ex: ...the influx of American popcorn into the British market.
example.tran: 美国爆米花大量涌入英国市场
